intro: Psychotria manongarivensis, commonly known as the Madagascar Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests. It produces small, dark berries that are typically consumed by local fauna. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
